results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders
results.creator_credit: Film Associates of California and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by the creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis as well as their anatomical and physiological characteristics.

results.title: Amphibians
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads, and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by these three creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis; feeding habits; hibernation; cold-bloodedness, skin and skeletal characteristics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Amore
results.brief_description:
Michel, a young architect is sent by the French government to Venice with a mision to try and find a solution to save an island. Paolo, a young photographer, offers to help Michel in his discovery of the city. He also introduces him to the beautiful Marina.

Credits: Director, Henry Chapier ; writers, Anne Capelle, Henry Chapier ; photoraphy, Alain Derobe ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: Sonia Petrova, Daniel Quenaud, Julian Negulesco, Henri Deus, Daniel Ceccaldi.

results.title: Among the wild chimpanzees
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Barbara Jampel
results.brief_description: Presents an account of Jane Goodall’s continuing research project with wild chimpanzees in Tanzania. Details her discoveries that chimpanzees not only use but also make tools, they hunt meat and even kill one another. They also suffer from infectious human diseases. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary School students.

results.title: Among giants
results.creator_credit: Fox Searchlight Pictures, Capitol Films, Kudos, BBC Film Unit, YMPA, Stephen Garrett and Sam Miller
results.brief_description: From the writer of “The Full monty”, Simon Beaufoy, comes “Among giants”, a tale set in Sheffield, England about a group of unemployed blue-collar workers who take on odd jobs to make ends meet. The latest of these high risk ventures is an unofficial contract to paint miles of power towers on the remote and beautiful Yorkshire Moors. The group are an eclectic mix of ageing hippies and adrenalin seeking rock climbers, very laddish in their encounters with one another. Into this all male crew enters Gerry (Rachel Griffiths) a feisty, fearless, mountain climbing Australian backpacker, who upsets the working life and social order of the group. Gerry falls for her boss Ray (Pete Postlethwaite) fuelling problems for both of them with his ex-wife, and with his best friend, Steven. Tensions rise as racing against the clock, the crew strives to complete the job, whilst Ray and Gerry struggle to resolve the status of their relationship. Billed as a romantic comedy, the film is situated in the tradition of light hearted tales of the woes of English working class life.

results.title: Among fish
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jodoin and Kenneth McCready
results.brief_description: A demonstration, for junior science classes, of what fish are, how they live, breathe, swim and, more remarkable, how they float up or down by manipulating their air bladder. The fish shown in the film are of the kind native to Canada’s lakes and streams, but others, of the tropical variety, are observed in the miniature marine world of a classroom aquarium. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Amoeba
results.brief_description: This one-celled organism has been photographed as a solid object and not, as diagrammatic represent- ations suggest, a flat object in one plane. The production of pseudopods is shown - the amoeba pursuing and capturing its prey and ingesting living organisms

results.title: Amisk
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Alanis Obomsawin, Wolf Koenig and Dorothy Courtois
results.brief_description: A week-long festival was organised by a group of Montreal citizens to raise funds in support of the Cree Indians who stood to lose their land because of the James Bay hydro-electric project. This film alternates between the spectacular performances of the Indian and Inuit peoples and the meeting halls of Mistassini where they talk of their past to defend their future.

results.title: American square dance
results.brief_description: Couples demonstrate the meaning of the following square dance terms: honour your partner, honour your corner, swing, allemande left, grand right and left, promenade, go visiting, right and left back, two ladies change, change right back, right and left through, four hands up and away we go, half way round and a do-si-do, all drops hands. The dance “Take a little peep” is demonstrated.

The dance “Take a little peep” is demonstrated.

results.title: American splendor
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Fine Line Features, Ted Hope, Robert Pulcini and Shari Springer Berman
results.brief_description: The life and times of American comic book writer Harvey Pekar - meet the real man, and the actor playing him (Paul Giamatti), in a movie about his “ordinary life”. Based on Harvey’s comic book “American Splendor” written by Harvey and illustrated by R.Crumb, he details the mundanities of ordinary life in such a way that makes for a great commentary on working class life in everyday America. The film covers the period of Harvey’s life when he gets divorced, looses his voice and compulsively collects old jazz records, to the time when he meets his new wife (Hope Davis), goes on the “Letterman” show to promote the comic, gets cancer and goes on to be part of this film. Cleverly realised we traverse his life via comics and actors, as well as interjections from the real Harvey, making an “ordinary life” quite compelling viewing.
